metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20771 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
On April 20, 2022, the following vulnerability in the ClamAV scanning library versions 0.103.5 and earlier and 0.104.2 and earlier was disclosed: A vulnerability in the TIFF file parser of Clam AntiVirus (ClamAV) versions 0.104.0 through 0.104.2 and LTS version 0.103.5 and prior versions could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service condition on an affected device. For a description of this vulnerability, see the ClamAV blog. This advisory will be updated as additional information becomes available.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-20771` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
clamav-base - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
clamav-daemon - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
clamav-milter - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
clamdscan - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libclamav9 - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
